Title: Laurent Kemp√© - Model Context Protocol Made Easy: Building an MCP Server in C#
Description: In my previous post, I demonstrated how to use C# with Microsoft.Extensions.AI, Ollama, and a nuget package called mcpdotnet to interact with an existing MCP Server. Since then, mcpdotnet has been elevated to become the ‚Äúofficial C# SDK for Model Context Protocol servers and clients, maintained by Microsoft‚Äù.

Title: Automating Apple Builds: A Practical Guide to GitHub Secrets
Description: In this post, I show how to set up GitHub Secrets to securely manage credentials for automated Apple builds.

Title: Monster Cables picked the wrong guy to threaten
Description: Monster Cables, which makes extremely high-priced stereo cables, has apparently sent a cease-and-desist letter to Blue Jeans Cable, alleging various kinds of infringement. Bad move ‚Äì the pres‚Ä¶

Title: New USPTO Memo Makes Fighting Patent Trolls Even Harder
Description: The U.S. Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) just made a move that will protect bad patents at the expense of everyone else. In a memo released February 28, the USPTO further restricted access to inter partes review, or IPR‚Äîthe process Congress created to let the public challenge invalid patents...

Title: All About Vibe Coding - Engineering Manager AMA
Description:
It's all the rage these days and everyone from your hair stylist to your fish groomer is talking about it... Vibe coding!

What the heck is it? Who is it good for? Are the vibes immaculate? Let's find out.

As with all livestreams, I'm looking forward to answering YOUR questions! So join me live and ask in the chat, or you can comment now and I can try to get it answered while I stream.

Title: Weekly Recap - 2025-03-21
Description: Check out this week from Dev Leader! Here's a list including articles and videos on software engineering, career development, and programming in C#!

Title: The little book about OS development
Description: This text is a practical guide to writing your own x86 operating system. It is designed to give enough help with the technical details while at the same time not reveal too much with samples and code excerpts. We‚Äôve tried to collect parts of the vast (and often excellent) expanse of material and tutorials available, on the web and otherwise, and add our own insights into the problems we encountered and struggled with.

Title: Pen and Paper Exercises in Machine Learning
Description: This is a collection of (mostly) pen-and-paper exercises in machine learning. The exercises are on the following topics: linear algebra, optimisation, directed graphical models, undirected graphical models, expressive power of graphical models, factor graphs and message passing, inference for hidden Markov models, model-based learning (including ICA and unnormalised models), sampling and Monte-Carlo integration, and variational inference.

Title: Options Pattern Validation in ASP.NET Core With FluentValidation
Description: Elevate your ASP.NET Core configuration with FluentValidation integration that catches configuration errors at startup, preventing silent failures and runtime exceptions with more expressive validation rules than Data Annotations.

Title: Matched and Deleted
Description: The curious case of Hinge and SATC

Title: Indefinite Backpack Travel ‚Äì Jeremy Maluf
Description: Updated September 2024

Title: How I force LLMs to generate correct code
Description: Unvibe: A Python Test-Runner that generates correct code

Title: Database Protocols Are Underwhelming
Description: If you‚Äôve been in this trade for a while, you have probably seen dozens of debates on the merits and problems of SQL as a relational database query language. As an ORM maintainer, I have a few gripes with SQL, but overall it is workable, and anyway, it has so much inertia that there‚Äôs no point fantasizing about a replacement.

Title: Early Thoughts on OpenAI‚Äôs ‚ÄòAgents‚Äô
Description: ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt an agent just an LLM workflow?‚Äù. This has been true of a lot of companies building ‚Äúagents‚Äù recently. I like Anthropic‚Äôs definition, which is a program that can use tools and make its own decisions.

Title: Use Long Options in Scripts
Description:
Many command line utilities support short form options (-f) and long form options (--force).
Short form is for interactive usage. In scripts, use the long form.

Title: Rusty string formatting in PHP
Description: Exploring software development with PHP, JavaScript, Rust, and beyond.

Title: "Vibe Coding" vs Reality
Description: Reviewing the capabilities and limitations of LLM agents in software development and their impact on skilled and less skilled developers.

Title: The Software Engineering Identity Crisis - Annie Vella
Description:
Many of us became software engineers because we found our identity in building things. Not managing things. Not overseeing things. Building things. With our own hands, our own minds, our own code.
But that identity is being challenged.
AI coding assistants aren‚Äôt just changing how we write software - they‚Äôre fundamentally transforming who we are. We‚Äôre shifting from creators to orchestrators, from builders to overseers. From engineers to something that looks suspiciously like‚Ä¶ managers.

Title: I made an app for competitive hot air balloon pilots
Description: This is a fairly long story of why I built Balloon Navigator, what‚Äôs involved to fly with centimeters level precision when you can only use wind and how technology is shaping modern ballooning today.

Title: LLM Assisted Fuzzing
Description: A new approach to false-positives.

Title: Don't guessbuild
Description: How we avoid guessbuilding at Operately by stopping feature development where certainty ends and speculation begins.

Title: Why you shouldn't start with a mobile app
Description: Why starting your project with a web-based MVP is often faster and more cost-effective? They simplify development, reduce costs, and enable quick iterations‚Äîwithout sacrificing quality.

Title: How to have great taste
Description: Taste is what differentiates the good from the great. So, how can I have better taste? This is my ongoing log of what I have learned.
